intro: Aloe pentagona, commonly known as the five-angle aloe, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color and have a distinctive pentagonal shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in racemes. Aloe pentagona is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves and requiring minimal watering. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
